afd-bar-line.blurb: Line number to use for inserting AFD/Bar data (0 = disabled)

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to pull per buffer (0 = default)

cc-line.blurb: Line number to use for inserting closed captions (0 = disabled)

duplex-mode.blurb: Certain DeckLink devices such as the DeckLink Quad 2 and the DeckLink Duo 2 support configuration of the duplex mode of individual sub-devices.A sub-device configured as full-duplex will use two connectors, which allows simultaneous capture and playback, internal keying, and fill & key scenarios.A half-duplex sub-device will use a single connector as an individual capture or playback channel.

hw-serial-number.blurb: The serial number (hardware ID) of the Decklink card

last-sample.blurb: The last sample received in the sink

max-bitrate.blurb: The maximum bits per second to render (0 = disabled)

max-lateness.blurb: Maximum number of nanoseconds that a buffer can be late before it is dropped (-1 unlimited)

mode.blurb: Video Mode to use for playback

render-delay.blurb: Additional render delay of the sink in nanoseconds

throttle-time.blurb: The time to keep between rendered buffers (0 = disabled)

timecode-format.blurb: Timecode format type to use for playback

video-format.blurb: Video format type to use for playback

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to read per buffer (-1 = default)

buffer-size.blurb: Size of internal buffer in number of video frames

do-timestamp.blurb: Apply current stream time to buffers

drop-no-signal-frames.blurb: Drop frames that are marked as having no input signal

duplex-mode.blurb: Certain DeckLink devices such as the DeckLink Quad 2 and the DeckLink Duo 2 support configuration of the duplex mode of individual sub-devices.A sub-device configured as full-duplex will use two connectors, which allows simultaneous capture and playback, internal keying, and fill & key scenarios.A half-duplex sub-device will use a single connector as an individual capture or playback channel.

hw-serial-number.blurb: The serial number (hardware ID) of the Decklink card

mode.blurb: Video Mode to use for playback

num-buffers.blurb: Number of buffers to output before sending EOS (-1 = unlimited)

output-afd-bar.blurb: Extract and output AFD/Bar as GstMeta (if present)

output-cc.blurb: Extract and output CC as GstMeta (if present)

output-stream-time.blurb: Output stream time directly instead of translating to pipeline clock

signal.blurb: True if there is a valid input signal available

skip-first-time.blurb: Skip that much time of initial frames after starting

timecode-format.blurb: Timecode format type to use for input

video-format.blurb: Video format type to use for input (Only use auto for mode=auto)

blocksize.blurb: Size in bytes to pull per buffer (0 = default)

last-sample.blurb: The last sample received in the sink

layer-mode.blurb: The cooperative level handling the access permission (set this to 'administrative' when the cursor is required)

max-bitrate.blurb: The maximum bits per second to render (0 = disabled)

max-lateness.blurb: Maximum number of nanoseconds that a buffer can be late before it is dropped (-1 unlimited)

b--zier-spline.blurb: Use cubic Bézier spline. Has to be a sorted list of points in the format "handle1x;handle1y#pointx;pointy#handle2x;handle2y"(pointx = in, pointy = out). Points are separated by a "|".The values can have "double" precision. x, y for points should be in the range 0-1. x,y for handles might also be out of this range.

channel.blurb: Channel to adjust (0 = red, 0.1 = green, 0.2 = blue, 0.3 = alpha, 0.4 = luma, 0.5 = rgb, 0.6 = hue, 0.7 = saturation)

curve-point-number.blurb: Number of points to use to build curve (/10 to fit [0,1] parameter range). Minimum 2 (0.2), Maximum 5 (0.5). Not relevant for Bézier spline.

graph-position.blurb: Output image corner where curve graph will be drawn (0.1 = TOP,LEFT; 0.2 = TOP,RIGHT; 0.3 = BOTTOM,LEFT; 0.4 = BOTTOM, RIGHT)

show-curves.blurb: Draw curve graph on output image

color-map.blurb: The color map to use. One of 'earth', 'grayscale', 'heat' or 'rainbow'.

index-calculation.blurb: The index calculation to use. One of 'ndvi' or 'vi'.

legend.blurb: Control legend display. One of 'off' or 'bottom'.

levels.blurb: The number of color levels to use in the false image (divided by 1000).

nir-channel.blurb: The channel to use for the near-infrared component. One of 'r', 'g', or 'b'.

nir-offset.blurb: An offset to be applied to the near-infrared component (mapped to [-100%%, 100%%].

nir-scale.blurb: A scaling factor to be applied to the near-infrared component (divided by 10).

vis-offset.blurb: An offset to be applied to the visible component (mapped to [-100%%, 100%%].

vis-scale.blurb: A scaling factor to be applied to the visible component (divided by 10).

visible-channel.blurb: The channel to use for the visible component. One of 'r', 'g', or 'b'.

color.blurb: If type is gaussian, this means the standard deviation.If type is bilateral, this means the color-sigma. If zero, Default values are used.

height.blurb: Height of the area to blur (in pixels).

kernel-height.blurb: The gaussian kernel height (must be positive and odd).

kernel-width.blurb: The gaussian kernel width (must be positive and odd).If type is median, this means the aperture linear size.Check OpenCV docs: http://docs.opencv.org/2.4/modules/imgproc/doc/filtering.htm

position-x.blurb: Starting x position for blur (in pixels).

position-y.blurb: Starting y position for blur (in pixels).

spatial.blurb: Only used in bilateral type, means the spatial-sigma.

width.blurb: Width of the area to blur (in pixels).

display-mode.blurb: How to display the dewarped image

values.desc: Dewarped image is splitted in two images displayed one below the other
values.name: double-panorama

values.desc: Dewarped image is splitted in four images dysplayed as a quad view
values.name: quad-view

inner-radius.blurb: Inner radius of the fisheye image donut. If outer radius <= inner radius the element will work in passthrough mode

values.desc: A bicubic interpolation over 4x4 pixel neighborhood
values.name: bicubic

values.desc: A Lanczos interpolation over 8x8 pixel neighborhood
values.name: Lanczos

outer-radius.blurb: Outer radius of the fisheye image donut. If outer radius <= inner radius the element will work in passthrough mode

x-center.blurb: X axis center of the fisheye image

x-remap-correction.blurb: Correction factor for remapping on x axis. A correction is needed if the fisheye image is not inside a circle

y-center.blurb: Y axis center of the fisheye image

y-remap-correction.blurb: Correction factor for remapping on y axis. A correction is needed if the fisheye image is not inside a circle

disparity.name: disparity

grabcut.author: Miguel Casas-Sanchez <miguelecasassanchez@gmail.com>
grabcut.description:
Runs Grabcut algorithm on input alpha. Values: BG=0, FG=1, PR_BG=2, PR_FGD=3; NOTE: larger values of alpha (notably 255) are interpreted as PR_FGD too. 
IN CASE OF no alpha mask input (all 0's or all 1's), the 'face' downstream event is used to create a bbox of PR_FG elements.
IF nothing is present, then nothing is done.
grabcut.name: grabcut

ice-gathering-state.blurb: The collective gathering state of all ICETransport's

ice-transport-policy.blurb: The policy to apply for ICE transport

local-description.blurb: The local SDP description to use for this connection

remote-description.blurb: The remote SDP description to use for this connection

signaling-state.blurb: The signaling state of this element

stun-server.blurb: The STUN server of the form stun://hostname:port

turn-server.blurb: The TURN server of the form turn(s)://username:password@host:port. This is a convenience property, use #GstWebRTCBin::add-turn-server if you wish to use multiple TURN servers

compression-gain-db.blurb: Sets the maximum |gain| the digital compression stage may apply, in dB.

delay-agnostic.blurb: Enable or disable the delay agnostic mode.

echo-suppression-level.blurb: Controls the aggressiveness of the suppressor. A higher level trades off double-talk performance for increased echo suppression.

experimental-agc.blurb: Enable or disable experimental automatic gain control.

extended-filter.blurb: Enable or disable the extended filter.

gain-control.blurb: Enable or disable automatic digital gain control

gain-control-mode.blurb: Controls the mode of the compression stage

high-pass-filter.blurb: Enable or disable high pass filtering

limiter.blurb: When enabled, the compression stage will hard limit the signal to the target level. Otherwise, the signal will be compressed but not limited above the target level.

noise-suppression-level.blurb: Controls the aggressiveness of the suppression. Increasing the level will reduce the noise level at the expense of a higher speech distortion.

probe.blurb: The name of the webrtcechoprobe element that record the audio being played through loud speakers. Must be set before PAUSED state.

startup-min-volume.blurb: At startup the experimental AGC moves the microphone volume up to |startup_min_volume| if the current microphone volume is set too low. No effect if experimental-agc isn't enabled.

target-level-dbfs.blurb: Sets the target peak |level| (or envelope) of the gain control in dBFS (decibels from digital full-scale).

voice-detection.blurb: Enable or disable the voice activity detector

voice-detection-frame-size-ms.blurb: Sets the |size| of the frames in ms on which the VAD will operate. Larger frames will improve detection accuracy, but reduce the frequency of updates

voice-detection-likelihood.blurb: Specifies the likelihood that a frame will be declared to contain voice.

current-subsong.blurb: Subsong that is currently selected for playback

enhanced-resampling.blurb: Use enhanced resampling if set to TRUE, or linear interpolation if set to FALSE

log-volume-scale.blurb: Use a logarithmic volume scale if set to TRUE, or a linear scale if set to FALSE

num-loops.blurb: Number of times a playback loop shall be executed (special values: 0 = no looping; -1 = infinite loop)

output-buffer-size.blurb: Size of each output buffer, in samples (actual size can be smaller than this during flush or EOS)

output-mode.blurb: Which mode playback shall use when a loop is encountered; looping = reset position to start of loop, steady = do not reset position

reverb.blurb: Whether or not to enable the WildMidi 8 reflection reverb engine to add more depth to the sound

subsong-mode.blurb: Mode which defines how to treat subsongs
